member.name: M:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputFunctions.GetRawInputDeviceList(SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputDevicelist[],System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerates the raw input devices attached to the system.

param.name: rawInputDeviceListRef
param.para: An array of structures for the devices attached to the system. If null, the number of devices are returned in *puiNumDevices.

param.name: uiNumDevicesRef
param.para: If pRawInputDeviceList is null, the function populates this variable with the number of devices attached to the system; otherwise, this variable specifies the number of structures that can be contained in the buffer to which pRawInputDeviceList points. If this value is less than the number of devices attached to the system, the function returns the actual number of devices in this variable and fails with .

param.name: cbSize
param.para: The size of a structure, in bytes.

member.returns: If the function is successful, the return value is the number of devices stored in the buffer pointed to by pRawInputDeviceList.On any other error, the function returns (UINT) -1 and GetLastError returns the error indication.
member.remarks: The devices returned from this function are the mouse, the keyboard, and other Human Interface Device (HID) devices.To get more detailed information about the attached devices, call GetRawInputDeviceInfo using the hDevice from .
member.unmanaged: unsigned int GetRawInputDeviceList([Out, Buffer, Optional] RAWINPUTDEVICELIST* pRawInputDeviceList,[InOut] unsigned int* puiNumDevices,[In] unsigned int cbSize)

member.name: M:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputFunctions.RegisterRawInputDevices(SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputDevice[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers the devices that supply the raw input data.

param.name: rawInputDevicesRef
param.para: An array of structures that represent the devices that supply the raw input.

param.name: uiNumDevices
param.para: The number of structures pointed to by pRawInputDevices.

param.name: cbSize
param.para: The size, in bytes, of a structure.

member.returns: TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise, . If the function fails, call GetLastError for more information.
member.remarks: To receive WM_INPUT messages, an application must first register the raw input devices using RegisterRawInputDevices. By default, an application does not receive raw input.To receive WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE messages, an application must specify the flag for each device class that is specified by the usUsagePage and usUsage fields of the structure . By default, an application does not receive WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE notifications for raw input device arrival and removal.If a structure has the flag set and the hwndTarget parameter is not set to null, then parameter validation will fail.
member.unmanaged: BOOL RegisterRawInputDevices([In, Buffer] const RAWINPUTDEVICE* pRawInputDevices,[In] unsigned int uiNumDevices,[In] unsigned int cbSize)

member.name: M:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputFunctions.GetRawInputBuffer(SharpDX.RawInput.RawInput[],System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a buffered read of the raw input data.

param.name: dataRef
param.para: A reference to a buffer of structures that contain the raw input data. If null, the minimum required buffer, in bytes, is returned in *pcbSize.

param.name: cbSizeRef
param.para: The size, in bytes, of a structure.

param.name: cbSizeHeader
param.para: The size, in bytes, of the structure.

member.returns: If pData is null and the function is successful, the return value is zero. If pData is not null and the function is successful, the return value is the number of structures written to pData.If an error occurs, the return value is (UINT)-1. Call GetLastError for the error code.
member.unmanaged: unsigned int GetRawInputBuffer([Out, Buffer, Optional] RAWINPUT* pData,[InOut] unsigned int* pcbSize,[In] unsigned int cbSizeHeader)

member.name: M:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputFunctions.GetRegisteredRawInputDevices(SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputDevice[],System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the information about the raw input devices for the current application.

param.name: rawInputDevicesRef
param.para: An array of structures for the application.

param.name: cbSize
param.para: The size, in bytes, of a structure.

member.returns: If successful, the function returns a non-negative number that is the number of structures written to the buffer.If the pRawInputDevices buffer is too small or null, the function sets the last error as , returns -1, and sets puiNumDevices to the required number of devices. If the function fails for any other reason, it returns -1. For more details, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: To receive raw input from a device, an application must register it by using RegisterRawInputDevices.
member.unmanaged: unsigned int GetRegisteredRawInputDevices([Out, Buffer, Optional] RAWINPUTDEVICE* pRawInputDevices,[InOut] unsigned int* puiNumDevices,[In] unsigned int cbSize)

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawDeviceInformation
member.summary: Defines the raw input data coming from any device.

summary.para: The size, in bytes, of the structure.
If dwType is , this is the structure that defines the mouse.
If dwType is , this is the structure that defines the keyboard.
If dwType is , this is the structure that defines the HID device.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawDeviceInformationHid
member.summary: Defines the raw input data coming from the specified Human Interface Device (HID).

summary.para: The vendor identifier for the HID.
The product identifier for the HID.
The version number for the HID.
The top-level collection Usage Page for the device.
The top-level collection Usage for the device.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawDeviceInformationKeyboard
member.summary: Defines the raw input data coming from the specified keyboard.
member.remarks: For the keyboard, the Usage Page is 1 and the Usage is 6.

summary.para: The type of the keyboard.
The subtype of the keyboard.
The scan code mode.
The number of function keys on the keyboard.
The number of LED indicators on the keyboard.
The total number of keys on the keyboard.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawDeviceInformationMouse
member.summary: Defines the raw input data coming from the specified mouse.
member.remarks: For the mouse, the Usage Page is 1 and the Usage is 2.

summary.para: The identifier of the mouse device.
The number of buttons for the mouse.
The number of data points per second. This information may not be applicable for every mouse device.

member.name: P:SharpDX.RawInput.RawDeviceInformationMouse.HasHorizontalWheel
member.summary: TRUE if the mouse has a wheel for horizontal scrolling; otherwise, . Windows?XP:??This member is only supported starting with Windows?Vista.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawHid
member.summary: Describes the format of the raw input from a Human Interface Device (HID).
member.remarks: Each WM_INPUT can indicate several inputs, but all of the inputs come from the same HID. The size of the bRawData array is dwSizeHid * dwCount.

summary.para: The size, in bytes, of each HID input in bRawData.
The number of HID inputs in bRawData.
The raw input data, as an array of bytes.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInput
member.summary: Contains the raw input from a device.
member.remarks: The handle to this structure is passed in the lParam parameter of WM_INPUT.To get detailed information -- such as the header and the content of the raw input -- call GetRawInputData.To read the in the message loop as a buffered read, call GetRawInputBuffer.To get device specific information, call GetRawInputDeviceInfo with the hDevice from .Raw input is available only when the application calls RegisterRawInputDevices with valid device specifications.

summary.para: The raw input data.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputDevice
member.summary: Defines information for the raw input devices.
member.remarks: If is set for a mouse or a keyboard, the system does not generate any legacy message for that device for the application. For example, if the mouse TLC is set with , WM_LBUTTONDOWN and related legacy mouse messages are not generated. Likewise, if the keyboard TLC is set with , and related legacy keyboard messages are not generated.If is set and the hwndTarget member is not set to null, then parameter validation will fail.

summary.para: Top level collection Usage page for the raw input device.
Top level collection Usage for the raw input device.
A handle to the target window. If null it follows the keyboard focus.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputDevicelist
member.summary: Contains information about a raw input device.

summary.para: A handle to the raw input device.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawInputHeader
member.summary: Contains the header information that is part of the raw input data.
member.remarks: To get more information on the device, use hDevice in a call to GetRawInputDeviceInfo.

summary.para: The size, in bytes, of the entire input packet of data. This includes plus possible extra input reports in the variable length array.
A handle to the device generating the raw input data.
The value passed in the wParam parameter of the WM_INPUT message.

member.name: T:SharpDX.RawInput.RawKeyboard
member.summary: Contains information about the state of the keyboard.

summary.para: The scan code from the key depression. The scan code for keyboard overrun is KEYBOARD_OVERRUN_MAKE_CODE.
Reserved; must be zero.
Windows message compatible virtual-key code. For more information, see Virtual Key Codes.
The corresponding window message, for example , , and so forth.
The device-specific additional information for the event.
